body.p:
Louisa Lawrence Co Ky
April 30th 1861,
Dear Governor,

Wm Webb was fined this term of this court, $30 for three acts of Retailing, He did make some apple Brandy and he did sell Three quarts of it under the Belief he could lawfully do so but, it was drunk at the place of sale,
I know this is a case in which you ought to remit the fine Webb is an Honest clever man, and I hope you will send him, a remission

Yours Truly
J M Nesbitt
Comth Atto 11th Circuit

To His Excelleny Beriah Magoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioners would humbly represent that Wm Webb was at this the April Term of the Laurence circuit Court found guilty of three acts of retailing and find thirty dollars that the selling accured as follows Webb was a distiller of Apple brandy and sold the same at his house believing he had a right to do so and the same was drank on his premises he is a man of honesty loyalty and obedient to the Law and would not violate the Law Knowingly. We ask most humbly your excellency to remit the fine imposed upon him

L Moore
J W Haws S L C
John M Rice
Walter Osburn J P L C
Jas Hensley
J W Hensly
Isaac Hensley
Wm Shore
Thomas Hensly
J M. Rice

Lawrence Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M
$30
Wm Webb
Issd. May 11. 1861
